posts.post_content:
You guys don't understand why its casting cost is ![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol). Here's the true story.  
  
First, *what*, exactly, is a burn spell? [Ember Shot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ember Shot) is you throwing burning coals at someone. [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) is you siphoning the immense power of Mother Nature to summon forth a colossal bolt of electricity directed with pinpoint accuracy at a target that may be no larger than a [fly](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=19719).  
  
*They both deal 3 damage.* Let me remind you: that's enough to kill a fully-grown [elephant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=4527).  
  
So yeah, that's some really damn good coal, but why the extra ![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol) ?  
  
Well, the dwarves would normally only sell you their worst coal, and it would cost you ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol). But you're no pushover in the marketplace; you want the best of the best, and you WILL get what you want, standard trading conventions be damned! So you [coerce](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coercion) and [bribe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bribery) y... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Salient (1/11/2012 7:00:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You guys are missing the obvious design here.
  
   
[Flare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flare) is 2R. You draw one card and you do 1 damage. Obviously the colourless is to draw the card and the red is for the damage. This is a balanced spell because red is supposed to suck at cantrips.
  
   
Triple those two colourless mana = 6R. So you do one damage and draw three cards.
  
   
Wait, draw three cards? That isn't very red. Better make it do 3 damage.
  
   
And there you have a brand new magic card.
posts.html:
You guys are missing the obvious design here.

Flare is 2R. You draw one card and you do 1 damage. Obviously the colourless is to draw the card and the red is for the damage. This is a balanced spell because red is supposed to suck at cantrips.

Triple those two colourless mana = 6R. So you do one damage and draw three cards.

Wait, draw three cards? That isn't very red. Better make it do 3 damage.

And there you have a brand new magic card.

posts.post_content: No, no, no. See, you're paying 1R for the 3 damage, so [Searing Spear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Searing Spear). Then the card draw is an extra 1. Instant speed card draw adds another 1 onto that, so you have 3R. But it's gotta be inefficient if it doesn't cost you a card, so it adds on an extra 1. And as for that last 2 colorless mana? That's so that you can't play this and [Storm Crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Crow) on the same turn. Otherwise it would be broken.
